description: Allows a user to log in using either their Username/Password or a linked Google account. The system validates the credentials before granting access.
Allows an authenticated user to securely end their session and return to the Login screen.
After login, the system displays a personalized dashboard with key information and shortcuts relevant to the user's role.
Allows a user to initiate the password reset process by submitting their registered email address from the Login screen to receive a reset link.
Allows a user to set a new password by following the secure link sent to their email and successfully validating the reset token.
Allows a logged-in user to change their current password by providing their old password and a new one, typically via their Profile screen.
Allows a student to view their personal class and exam schedule for a selected semester.
Allows a student to view detailed information for a specific slot from their schedule, including announcements.
Allows a student to send a one-way message to the lecturer of a specific class slot.
Allows a student to view their own attendance history for past slots.
Allows a student to view a feed of notifications, including system alerts and slot-specific announcements.
Allows a new student to submit their identity credentials (facial video, ID card) for verification by a Data Operator.
Allows a student to submit a request to update their identity profile, which is routed to a Data Operator for approval.
Allows a lecturer to view their personal teaching and supervision schedule for a selected semester.
Allows the assigned staff to start the first automated attendance scan for a slot. This action activates the assigned camera(s) and the on-screen button will subsequently change to "Re-scan".
Allows the assigned staff to trigger a new attendance scan while a session is active. The system will update student statuses based on the latest recognition results and record the event.
Allows a lecturer to view the class roster for an active session, where statuses are updated in real-time based on results from all assigned cameras.
Allows the assigned staff to view the detailed, timestamped attendance history for a specific student within a slot. The history is displayed as a timeline of all automated scans and manual edits.
Allows a lecturer to manually override a student's attendance status for a slot before finalization. A non-empty remark explaining the reason for the change is mandatory.
Allows a lecturer to add or modify a remark for a student's attendance record within a slot.

Allows a lecturer to end the attendance session. The system will display a "Finalization Rules Setup" screen for the lecturer to make bulk decisions on converting intermediate statuses (e.g., Not Yet) to a final status (Present or Absent).
Allows a lecturer to create and publish an announcement for a specific lecture slot.
Allows a lecturer to view all announcements they have created for a specific lecture slot.
Allows a lecturer to remove an existing announcement from a lecture slot.
Allows a lecturer to view a list of pre-slot messages sent by students for a specific lecture slot.
Allows a lecturer to mark a student's pre-slot message as 'read' or 'acknowledged'.
Allows a lecturer to export a detailed attendance report for a finalized lecture slot.
Allows a lecturer to view and export a summary attendance report for an entire class over a semester.
Allows a supervisor to view their personal supervision schedule for assigned exam slots.
Allows a supervisor to start the first automated attendance scan for an exam slot. This action activates the assigned camera(s) and the on-screen button will subsequently change to "Re-scan".
Allows a supervisor to view the exam roster for an active session, where statuses are updated in real-time based on results from all assigned cameras.
Allows a supervisor to manually override a candidate's attendance status for an exam slot before finalization. A non-empty remark explaining the reason for the change is mandatory.
Allows a supervisor to add or modify a remark for a candidate's attendance record within an exam slot.

Allows a supervisor to end the attendance session. The system will display a "Finalization Rules Setup" screen for the supervisor to make bulk decisions on converting intermediate statuses (e.g., Not Yet) to a final status (Present or Absent).
Allows a supervisor to export a detailed attendance report for a finalized exam slot.

Allows the DOP to create a new user by providing core details (username, email, full name). The operator must then create a specialized profile (Student or Staff) for the user to define their specific attributes and assign their base role.
Allows the DOP to view and search a list of all user accounts in the system.
Allows the DOP to edit the information of an existing user account.
Allows the DOP to change the role assigned to a user, subject to system constraints.
Allows the DOP to change the status of a user account to active or inactive.
Allows the DOP to view a queue of all identity registration and update requests that are awaiting manual review.
Allows the DOP to review the details of an identity submission (facial video, ID card) and approve it.
Allows the DOP to reject an identity submission, providing a reason for the rejection that is sent to the student.
Allows the DOP to add a new academic Major to the system-wide catalog.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all Majors in the system.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing Major.
Allows the DOP to disable a Major from the catalog.
Allows the DOP to create a new academic semester with a name, code, start date, and end date.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all semesters in the system.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing semester.
Allows the DOP to disable a semester.
Allows the DOP to add a new academic Subject to the catalog, linking it to a Major.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all Subjects in the system.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing Subject.
Allows the DOP to disable a Subject from the catalog.
Allows the DOP to create a new class, linking it to a subject and semester.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all classes for a selected semester.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing class.
Allows the DOP to disable a class.

Allows the DOP to create a new schedule slot for a class. After selecting the room, the operator must select one or more cameras from the list of available cameras in that room to be used for the session.
Allows the DOP to view the complete schedule for a class or semester.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of a scheduled slot, including changing the assigned cameras.
Allows the DOP to cancel a scheduled slot.
Allows the DOP to enroll a student into a specific class.
Allows the DOP to unenroll a student from a class.
Allows the DOP to add a new physical room to the system.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all rooms in the system.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing room.
Allows the DOP to disable a room.
Allows the DOP to register a new IP camera by providing its details and assigning it to a specific room.
Allows the DOP to view a list of all registered cameras.
Allows the DOP to edit the details of an existing camera, including re-assigning it to a different room.
Allows the DOP to delete a camera.
Allows the DOP to bulk-upload academic data (schedules, rosters) for a semester.
Allows the DOP to export system-wide, finalized attendance results for a selected period.
Allows the DOP to generate and view aggregate reports on attendance data across various dimensions.
Allows the DOP to perform advanced searches for specific attendance records using a variety of filters.
Allows the DOP to view a historical log of business data changes, which includes detailed before-and-after values for updates.
Allows the System Admin to create new system notification templates (e.g., for password resets, identity rejections).
Allows the System Admin to view and manage all system notification templates.
Allows the System Admin to edit the content and properties of an existing notification template.
Allows the System Admin to view all global, system-level settings.
Allows the System Admin to modify core system-level configurations to fine-tune system behavior.
Allows the System Admin to view a comprehensive stream of system-wide activity logs for monitoring and troubleshooting.
Allows the System Admin to export system logs for a specified time period for offline analysis or archival.
Allows the System Admin to view the current matrix that defines which permissions are granted to each user role.
Allows the System Admin to grant or revoke specific permissions for each role, controlling access to system functions.
